reviewText: Average Grade B movie.  Very predictable.
A well acted period film with an ending that rings true given the action and characterization.
Awesome cast.
This is a great movie with wonderful acting and the all too familiar story of love gone wrong.  The acting was superb.  Granger really played the bad boy role well.  Loved it

This movie is an excellent bit of gothic British cinema - a gothic romance in the truest sense, greater doom than Cathy & Heathcliff. Some really well turned out performances by an excellent cast, gorgeous costuming and excellent settings. Snow! Real snow, even - meaning that part of the filming happened during an actual winter (I'm really impressed). A bit melodramatic but quite worth watching.

I first saw this movie about 25 years ago and never forgot it.  Valerie Hobson and Stewart Granger are terrific; the whole production is beautifully done.

The DVD-R version from Retro Flix doesn't have any frills (no menus, no extras), just the movie.  The picture and sound quality are very good.  Thanks to Retro Flix for making this movie available on DVD!
Good, not great.
Excellent gothic romance with suspense and some unexpected turns throughout make it a great movie

A great little film that was not well received during its time. However, I think people who watch today will recognize it was ahead of its time. There are a few great ironic twists. Loosely based on a true account. Well done.
